para: This chapter gives a short overview of current Linux distributions.

A Linux distributiondistribution is a collection of (usually open source) software on top of a Linux kernel. A distribution (or short, distro) can bundle server software, system management tools, documentation and many desktop applications in a central secure software repositoryrepository. A distro aims to provide a common look and feel, secure and easy software management and often a specific operational purpose.
Let's take a look at some popular distributions.
